availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ethan Allen Brown (Hamilton County, Ohio, law student, notary public and 1st lieutenant (U.S.A))

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, law student, notary public, and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Daniel Wilson Brown and Esther Jane Brown. Student in Ashland County, Ohio, in 1850. Schoolteacher in Hamilton County in 1860. Law student and notary public in Hamilton County in 1861. Served in the 34th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from August 16, 1861, to October 7, 1862. Died in Gallipolis, Ohio, from wounds received at the Battle of Fayetteville, West Virginia, on October 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Ashland County, Ashland, p. 429B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Storrs, p. 86.

Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866, vol. 3 (Cincinnati: The Ohio Valley Pub. & MFG. Co., 1886), 589.
Registers of Deaths of Volunteers, Compiled 1861-1865, Records of the Adjutant General's Office, 1780's-1917, NARA RG 94, Ohio, A-B.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory (Cincinnati: C.S. Williams, 1861), 91.
